channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: High Point Market Spring 2013 Preview
item.description:
Apartment Therapy is in the sky, blazing towards North Carolina for the Spring 2013 High Point Market. Over the course of the weekend, our team will live-blog the event, bringing you fresh photo deliciousness in the form of home furnishings and decor.

More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Simon's DIY IKEA Kitchen Cupboard Door Hideaway Desk — DeskTops
item.description:
Name: Simon Pretty
Location: UK

I needed a decent desk, as I work from home once a week. Our place is small, so we needed something we could fold away, as the tiny room is also used to entertain guests. This corner was ideal for a desk, but has an awkward wall cutting across at 45 degrees, so I needed to custom-build a solution...

More
item.author: Gregory Han

item.title: How To Show Off Your Records With Style
item.description:
It seems like Record Store Day 2013 is marked down on more than few calendars among vinyl loving types. With special vinyl releases set for April 20th, you'll discover new music and full album artwork that is often worth displaying. I've compiled some of my favorite solutions for displaying or storing your favorite records once you get back home with your pile of good sounds...


More
item.author: Vahan Baladouni

item.title: Can I Split Living Room to Kitchen Prep & Storage Space? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q:  I will be moving into an apartment with quite possibly the smallest kitchen in the world, and I'm at a loss as to what to do with it. Clearly we didn't rent our apartment it for the kitchen (see: gigantic living room), and we're trying to find ways to extend our kitchen prep into the living room. The room is rather oddly shaped, but we were thinking of moving things like pantry staples, a cutting board and some appliances out into the living room, and dividing the room in two. Do y'all think this would work?

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: Faith's Kitchen Renovation: The Big Reveal!
item.description:
I've been sharing my kitchen renovation with you (see all the posts and the progression here). Today's finally the day: the big reveal! We are thrilled and feel so lucky — hope you enjoy the peek! 

• Faith's Big Kitchen Reveal!
  The Kitchn

More
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Mrs. Miller's Project: Garden Galore — Apartment Therapy + Donors Choose: Ready...Set...Grow!
item.description:
School: Curtis Creek Elementary 
City: Sonora, CA
Teachers: Mrs. Miller

Project: A school garden is in reality a lifelong goal. Whether it is science, enjoying the outdoors, reading, art, nature, get out into the garden. We are hoping that no matter what the pull, for you could not guess the varied number of possible attractions a garden could have for a school, the garden becomes part of their lives- today and always.

→Donate to Mrs. Miller's students on Apartment Therapy's Donors Choose page.


More
item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: How To Make Crunchy Caramel Popcorn
item.description:
If your only experience with caramel popcorn is the sticky-sweet stuff that comes Christmas tins, then I insist that you drop whatever you are currently doing and make yourself a batch right now.

• How To Make Crunchy Caramel Popcorn
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Wacky Double Duty Spring Cleaning Items Clip — Apartment Therapy Over Good Morning America
item.description:
Want to see what Apartment Therapy looks like on TV? I got full makeup and a gel in my hair this morning for this fun little segment on Good Morning America Live. These great DIY green tips are straight from our site, but talking in full sentences with three hosts and a crowd outside the window is a heck of a challenge. Sorry we can't skip the ad.
More
item.author: Maxwell Ryan

item.title: Studio Mates: A Workspace For Three — Lifework
item.description:
We often see studios that serve as co-working spaces for the creative professionals who work there. It’s not often, though, that we get to hear these studio mates talk about each other’s work. In this thoughtful interview with illustrator Julia Rothman, we not only get a glimpse inside her workspace, but also get a glimpse of the admiration she has for the women with whom she shares the office: artists Caroline Hwang and Meredith Jenks.

More
item.author: Gregory Han

item.title: Tauba Auerbach's Meditation On Marble
item.description:
Over the years, Apartment Therapy has focused quite a bit on marble: cleaning and maintaining it, protecting it, rehabbing it, faking it, using it in bathrooms, using it Shaker-style, the pros and cons of white marble countertops, scoring marble on a budget, and so much more. I was fascinated, then, to see Tauba Auerbach's celebration of marble, in book form...

More
item.author: Tess Wilson

item.title: Get the Look: Ellen & Portia's Art Barn
item.description:
When I saw the photos of Ellen Degeneres and Portia de Rossi's Santa Monica ranch last week, I instantly wanted to move in. I'm in a no-color phase right now and the neutral hues, especially in the Art Barn here, made me feel right at home. Like the look? Here are similar finds you can pick up even if you don't have the celebrity budget.

More
item.author: Theresa Gonzalez

item.title: How Do You Memorialize Loved Ones at Home?
item.description:
I'll admit to being shaken by Monday's events in Boston. I used to work and live near the marathon finish line, and have wandered down there numerous times to soak in the good feelings that permeate that area post-race. While I now live in Saint Louis, part of my heart is still in Boston and I'm grieving with everyone there.
More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: The Best of Vertical Gardening: Inspiration, DIY, & Resources
item.description:
Last week I talked about design dilemmas common with the quintessential rectangular urban yard, and space (or should I say, lack thereof), is usually at the top of the list. From inspiration to DIY's, tips on products available on the market and where to source them — this post will surely have you dreaming up new ways to best utilize a small footprint in the garden.

More
item.author: Kimber Watson

item.title: Claire & Jeffrey's Kitchen: The Big Reveal — Renovation Diary
item.description:
Name: Claire & Jeffrey
Type of Project: Kitchen remodel
Location: Minneapolis, Minnesota
Type of building: Single-family bungalow, 950 square feet

For all of us who have been following along with Claire and Jeffrey's renovation, the ultimate moment has finally arrived. That's right — the kitchen is finally complete, and it's time for the big reveal. 

More
item.author: Guest

item.title: A Modern Castle for Sirs Simon & Callum — Professional Project
item.description:
Project by: Meghan Shadrick/Meghan's Inspired Interiors
Location: Arlington, MA

My client wanted to make the most of the space for her two young boys sharing a bedroom, all the while keeping it fun, fanciful, and functional. Since the boys were sharing the room, she also wanted a spot for each boy to call their own. To top off the wishlist, they also needed a spot to sit and do homework. The boys longed for a castle themed room, and their wish was my command! 

More
item.author: Carrie McBride

item.title: Victor & Adrienne's DIY Cabin in the Sky — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Victor and Adrienne Barranco
Location: Woodbridge, Virginia
Size: 3570 square feet
Years lived in: 2 years, Own

Though situated in the suburban neighborhood of Woodbridge, Virginia, Victor Barranco and wife Adrienne’s home is built like a self-made cabin retreat in the woods. There is hardly an inch of the home that the couple did not remodel, paint, or build by hand. The crafty pair were kind enough to provide some before photos taken during the renovation process in what may be a first-time before and after House Tour post. You can view bits of the "before" process in the slideshow.

More
item.author: Nicole Crowder

item.title: Decorating with Chibi: Decor from a Chinchilla's Perspective
item.description:
It's been something of a tough week for me, and perhaps it has been for you as well, so it seems like an appropriate time for a fun exercise. Usually I write about human decor, but for today, I'm going to try to get inside the mind of my pet chinchilla to see what kind of decor he would prefer. Join me if you feel like a bit of silliness.

More
item.author: Carolyn Purnell

item.title: Are These Types of Insulation Safe? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: I recently moved into the garden apartment of a wonderfully located though poorly maintained building. I'm concerned about some exposed insulation around a heater pipe in the bedroom ceiling and in a window sill in the kitchen. It looks grim, though I don't know enough about insulation materials to determine if it's toxic. Anyone recognize these materials? Should I be concerned?

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: Beyond the Bucket: Sandbox & Beach Toys
item.description:
Sure, you've got your bucket and shovel, but if you have access to a good sandbox or (suppressing my jealousy) a beach - kick it up a notch with more sand toys. These are all small enough to be thrown in your stroller or beach bag  - just don't forget them when you leave.

More
item.author: Carrie McBride

item.title: Maxwell Talks Eco-Friendly Design Tips on HuffPost Live — Design News 04.18.13
item.description:
Our very own founder, Maxwell Ryan, was on HuffPost Live yesterday, sharing tips for going green in the city. Maxwell and Brie Dyas, senior editor of HuffPost Style & HuffPost Home, chatted about green design tips, plants and eco-friendly home cleaners in honor of Earth Day next week. 

In other news, there's a new composite wood made without adhesives or chemicals, and Tobey Maguire talks about the Great Gatsby sets. See the headlines after the jump.

More
item.author: Tara Bellucci

item.title: Info on Artist & Value of Bubblegum Machine Print? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: I found this great print at a local thrift store for only $8. I was wondering who the artist is and what it might be worth — any ideas?

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: Desk & Decor Ideas to Soften the Look of Black Leather Eames Chairs? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: I recently got extremely lucky and scored three Eames black leather soft pad executive chairs for an amazing price...don't be jealous! My husband and I are opening a very small (12' x 12') office space soon, and I wasn't planning on black leather desk chairs, but now I've got to work them into the style since they are classic...

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: 10 Portable Charging Solutions For Smartphone and Laptop Travelers
item.description:
Several of my coworkers are off to attend a trade show later this week, and the hot topic of the afternoon was portable battery charging options. Professionally, a drained smartphone or laptop could be the difference between updating live from the show or having to wait till the end of the day to connect and upload. Personally, it's just a bummer carrying around a lump of "good for nothing" when the battery is out...

More
item.author: Gregory Han

item.title: A Peek Inside the Home of Designer Marc Newson — Nowness
item.description:
Marc Newson has designed everything from digital cameras, to iconic aviation-inspired chaise lounges, and to this day, one of my favorite automobile concepts ever. His work continually exhibits a fascinating dichotomy of simple vs. complex, pared down basic forms integrated and executed with the tools of high technology. So it's with great pleasure I discovered a short video touring his London residence...

More
item.author: Gregory Han

item.title: SPONSORED POST: Win: $100 Gift Basket from Waterpik®! — Giveaway
item.description:
Item: $100 Gift Basket (5)
From: Waterpik®
Value: $100 (each)

Creating a spa-like sanctuary at home is a simple way to instill quiet and calm in your day. Any bathroom - big or small - can become an instant relaxation zone. To help you get started, Waterpik® is giving away five gift baskets, including a Waterpik RainFall+ showerhead (easily installed in 5 minutes!), gift card, and bath accessories. Simply enter below for your chance to win.

Enter for your chance to win one of five gift baskets from Waterpik!

item.author: Sponsored Post
